author: @cartacapital
title: Inclus√£o da carne na cesta b√°sica da tribut√°ria √© uma vit√≥ria de Lula, diz Haddad
text:
O ministro da Fazenda, Fernando Haddad (PT), afirmou nesta quinta-feira 11 ter sido uma vit√≥ria do presidente Lula (PT) a decis√£o da C√¢mara dos Deputados de incluir as carnes na cesta b√°sica do projeto de regulamenta√ß√£o da reforma tribut√°ria , com al√≠quota zerada.
‚ÄúEle [Lula] tinha feito uma manifesta√ß√£o p√∫blica de que a carne tinha que estar na cesta b√°sica, porque o acesso √† prote√≠na animal tem que ser garantido a todos os brasileiros‚Äù, disse Haddad em um v√≠deo ao lado da primeira-dama Janja da Silva. ‚ÄúFoi um acordo de lideran√ßa com todos os partidos, mesmo o PL, que votou contra a tribut√°ria . Conseguimos vencer a oposi√ß√£o e colocamos a carne na cesta b√°sica. ‚Äù
A decis√£o sobre as carnes surgiu de √∫ltima hora, na quarta 10. A prote√≠na animal n√£o constava da cesta no texto-base da proposta, aprovado com 336 votos a favor e 142 pela rejei√ß√£o, al√©m de duas absten√ß√µes.
Durante a vota√ß√£o dos destaques, por√©m, o relator no plen√°rio, Reginaldo Lopes (PT-MG), anunciou a mudan√ßa. ‚ÄúEm nome de todos os l√≠deres, estamos acolhendo no relat√≥rio da reforma todas as prote√≠nas. Carnes, peixes, queijos e, l√≥gico, o sal, que tamb√©m √© um ingrediente da culin√°ria brasileira‚Äù, disse o deputado petista. ‚ÄúQuero pedir a todos os l√≠deres que possamos juntos fazer de maneira simb√≥lica esta grande vota√ß√£o.‚Äù

author: Jack Alban
title: Woman Dodges New Car Payment, Installs Apple CarPlay in Acura
text:
A TikToker who goes by Heaven ( @purplyavocado ) is in car-driving bliss after she decided to upgrade her Acura (Honda‚Äôs luxury car brand, which is renowned for its reliability ) with a rear backup camera and Apple CarPlay system, instead of just buying a new car flat out for the newer features.
Not having an expensive monthly car payment, especially in America‚Äôs recently destroyed economy , is a blessing the TikToker is certainly enjoying. ‚ÄúMe with my $0 car payment because you can literally put Apple CarPlay & a backup camera in almost any car,‚Äù she wrote in the clip‚Äôs text overlay.
She pans the video over to her unit, which juts out from the car dash and it sports a large center knob, and a screen that appears to allow the user to pivot it from side to side.
Several other commenters replied that they, too, decided to upgrade their older vehicles with new infotainment systems and were very happy to do so.
‚ÄúMy dad put apple car play and a backup camera on my 1994 Honda Accord,‚Äù one TikToker wrote.
Someone else said, ‚ÄúThis but literally any car w bluetooth is good enough for me.‚Äù
‚ÄúPutting apple carplay in my car was the best decision i ever made,‚Äù a third replied.
Another individual wrote their ride was also upgraded: ‚ÄúMy brother put a reverse camera star lights and apple carplay in mines.‚Äù
If you‚Äôre driving an ‚Äúold reliable‚Äù car, like a Toyota Camry or Honda Civic that just refuses to die, you may be tempted to sell your whip in exchange for a newer vehicle with more ‚Äúluxurious‚Äù features. But as pretty much any financial analyst will tell you , buying a new car is one of the worst fiscal decisions you can ever make. The second you take the thing off of the lot, it significantly depreciates in value, and with the way interest rates are going now , what you‚Äôll pay for 2 months in new car payments will probably eclipse what you would spend on maintenance for a used tried-and-true vehicle.
It is tempting, however, to get a new car because of the updated amenities they may carry‚Äîlike a shiny new infotainment system, wireless Bluetooth calling capabilities, and a rear back-up camera.
But did you know that if you have an older model vehicle with a more rudimentary stereo set up, you could get these features installed for what is probably less than the cost of a brand-new car payment? It sounds like even more of an alluring option when you consider that there are new car purchasers out there who get stuck with high monthly payments .
How cheap is it? Let‚Äôs do some quick math.
@purplyavocado i love my car sm
‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì ùêãùêûùêöùêßùêßùêû ùêÄùêõùêùùêöùê•ùê•ùêöùê° Amazon sells this adjustable, highly-rated rear backup camera for a car for $19 . Now, when it comes to navigation or infotainment solutions, most people only want to use Apple Car Play or Android Auto for all their navigation, phone calls, and music-playing needs. There are tons of options folks can have installed in their vehicles that vary in pricing. There are models like this $400 Sony one that nestles right into the dash of your car for a seamless experience , depending on the model vehicle you have. There are other products with high ratings that sit higher above the dash that even offer wireless Car Play or Android Auto capabilities that cost less.
You don‚Äôt even need to know how to install these products yourself or worry about the circuitry, and you could always look for units that will specifically work for your car or at the very least fit them better‚Äîand it doesn‚Äôt cost that much to get them installed (or at least way less than buying a new car). Best Buy, for instance, charges $150 to install rear-backup cameras and even sells Apple Car Play receivers with ‚Äúfree installation‚Äù options as well .
So, let‚Äôs say you went with the $19 backup camera, plus the $150 to install it, and a $300 Apple Car Play system from Best Buy with free installation, you‚Äôre looking at $469 total to have your never-say-die vehicle that‚Äôs always been by your side with a new infotainment system.
The Daily Dot has reached out to Heaven via TikTok comment for further information.
The internet is chaotic‚Äîbut we‚Äôll break it down for you in one daily email. Sign up for the Daily Dot‚Äôs web_crawlr newsletter here to get the best (and worst) of the internet straight into your inbox.

author: Dallas Morning News Editorial
title: More counselors, better outcomes for Dallas ISD
text:
While the Legislature remains deadlocked over public school funding, Dallas ISD is in dire need of financial restraint in the coming months. A $186 million deficit means hard decisions would have to be made, but public school officials also need to be inventive about how to best use the available resources. Eliminating underperforming high school programs in DISD and redirecting resources to hire more student counselors is a smart approach. DISD officials are looking into enrollment numbers and whether these classes actually prepare students for high-demand jobs after graduation.
Advertisement By moving teachers to more productive positions, the district expects to revamp courses and put more students into career and college pathways. DISD also will free up $2.5 million to hire additional counselors, according to an early estimate. Superintendent Stephanie Elizalde wants to have a 300-to-1 counselor-to-student ratio. That would be closer to the American Counselor Association‚Äôs recommended ratio of 250 to 1.
Advertisement There is a big reason why this strategy makes sense: High school counselors have a direct influence on whether students graduate and attend college. A 2023 study found that student-to-counselor ratios in Texas are correlated with student outcomes, in particular academic achievement and graduation.
Opinion Get smart opinions on the topics North Texans care about.
Email Address By signing up you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Policy
SUBMIT Hiring more counselors is a good return on investment, Todd Williams, Commit Partnership CEO, told The News . ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs one of the few things that you can invest money in that actually has a dividend to it.‚Äù Commit is a nonprofit that works closely with some Dallas County school districts.
The ultimate goal is to boost the number of young residents in Dallas who can earn a livable wage. Right now, this goal is uncertain.
Advertisement The dropout rate is an enduring concern for DISD and changing the tide is vital for our future. At 80%, Dallas has the lowest four-year high school completion rate of the state‚Äôs largest urban districts. These numbers provided fuel to the private school voucher debate in the Legislature, so there is much work to be done.
Fewer students also means less funding for a district that already has enough to deal with, including the possibility of no teacher pay raises this year, a consequence of the political impasse in Austin over the voucher program. Districts were hopeful that a safety bill would provide additional funding, but that also fell apart in the last special session.
But even in the best of circumstances, making sure funding and strategy are aligned with graduation objectives should always be the guiding principle for school districts as they connect students with future jobs. Effective counseling is a good starting point.
Advertisement We welcome your thoughts in a letter to the editor. See the guidelines and submit your letter here . If you have problems with the form, you can submit via email at letters@dallasnews.com
